title: Teens charged in shooting death of 15-year-old boy
content:
Two teens were charged in the shooting death of a 15-year-old boy who was shot in the head while one of the teens handled a firearm inside a Humboldt Park apartment Friday afternoon.
Mario Venegas Jr. was pronounced dead Saturday morning at Stroger Hospital. Police said the boy had been shot in the 2700 block of West Evergreen Avenue about 1:25 p.m. the day before.
A 17-year-old boy was charged with involuntary manslaughter and felony unlawful possession of a firearm by someone under 18 years old. The boy lives on the block where Venegas was shot.
An 18-year-old, Orlando Gonzalez, was charged with felony aggravated unlawful use of a weapon. He lives in the 2000 block of North Hoyne Avenue, police said.
Court information for the two charged wasn't available.
The three were handling a gun inside the home when the gun accidentally discharged, according to police. The Cook County medical examiner's office ruled the boy's death a homicide by gunshot wound.
